Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BM Moricin (BM-Moricin A1, moricin1, moricinA1, natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli JM109 (Lethal Concentration 0.31uM), Acinetobacter sp. NISL B-4653 (LC 0.27uM), P. aeruginosa IAM15140 (LC 0.81uM), B. subtilis IAM1107 (LC 0.19uM), B. megaterium IAM1030 (LC 0.09uM), B. cereus IFO3457 (LC 0.38uM), S. aureus ATCC6538P (LC 0.21uM), S. xylosus IAM1312 (LC 0.27uM) and S. pyogenes ATCC21547 (LC 0.25uM). Provided by C. Wang.Structure:  1 long helix: 5-36 in methanol.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.MOA:bacteria:E. coli: acted on bacterial membranes. The N-terminal region is responsible for this action.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: expressed as fusion, chemical cleavage:CNBr; yield: 11 mg/L, the recombinant form with similar activity against E. coli and S. aureus.Updated 7/2012; 2/2014; 4/2019; 4/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Hara S, Yamakawa M.1995
Literature Information.Title: Moricin, a novel type of antibacterial peptide isolated from the silkworm, Bombyx mori.
